properties.areaDesc: Shoshone, ID; Bonner, ID; Boundary, ID; Kootenai, ID
properties.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 11 at 8:21AM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
The Idaho Panhandle Avalanche Center in Sandpoint has issued a
BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING for the following areas:
NWS Spokane WA - ID 017 (Bonner County)...ID 021 (Boundary
County)...ID 055 (Kootenai County)...ID 079 (Shoshone County)

* TIMING...In effect from Sat 08:00 MST to Sun 08:00 MST.

* AFFECTED AREA...All mountain areas of the Idaho Panhandle. The
Silver valley zone, Lookout pass / Selkirk and Cabinet mountains
/ Kootenai zone, mountains surrounding Troy and Libby Montana,
Purcell mountains

* AVALANCHE DANGER...THE AVALANCHE DANGER FOR THE WARNING AREA
WILL RISE TO HIGH TODAY.

* REASON/IMPACTS...RECENT HEAVY SNOW COMBINED WITH WIND WILL
RESULT IN WIDESPREAD AVALANCHING. HEAVY SNOW IS FALL ON A
ALREADY WEAK SNOWPACK. BACKCOUNTRY TRAVEL IS NOT RECOMMENDED

* PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...VERY DANGEROUS AVALANCHE
CONDITIONS. TRAVEL IN AVALANCHE TERRAIN IS NOT RECOMMENDED.
AVALANCHES MAY RUN LONG DISTANCES AND CAN RUN INTO MATURE
FORESTS, VALLEY FLOORS, OR FLAT TERRAIN.

Consult http://www.idahopanhandleavalanche.org/ or
www.avalanche.org for more detailed information.

Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the
coverage area of this or any avalanche center.

This information has been transmitted by the National Weather
Service at the request of the Idaho Panhandle Avalanche Center.
This center typically only issues warnings on Fridays.  The
absence of a warning on any other day of the week should not be
used to infer avalanche conditions on those days.
